qas.question: What classification does the Greek economy hold?
Greece help found what economic organizations?

answers.text: Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) and the Organization of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation (BSEC)

qas.question: When was Greece accepted into the European Union?
When did Greece start using the Euro as its currency?

context: The Greek economy is classified as <a0_0>advanced and high-income<a0_0/>. Greece was a founding member of the Organisation for <a1_0>Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) and the Organization of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation (BSEC)<a1_0/>. In 1979 the accession of the country in the European Communities and the single market was signed, and the process was completed in 1982. Greece was accepted into the Economic and Monetary Union of the European Union on <a2_0>19 June 2000<a2_0/>, and in <a3_0>January 2001<a3_0/> adopted the Euro as its currency, replacing <a4_0>the Greek drachma<a4_0/> at an exchange rate of 340.75 drachma to the Euro. Greece is also a member of the International Monetary Fund and the World Trade Organization, and is ranked 24th on the KOF Globalization Index for 2013.
